InfluenceRule.name: If i is kind, i is a little more likely to want to patch things up.
If i is insecure, i is a little more likely to want to patch things up so that he is secure in knowing he doesn't have anymore enemies.
If i is deep, i is a little more likely to want to patch things up because he does not want to be caught up in such petty matters.
If i is humble, i is a little more likely to want to patch things up.
If i is a pacifist, i is a little more likely to want to patch things up because he doesn't like to fight.
If i is forgiving, i is a more likely to want to patch things up because he is quick to forgive.
If i is shy, i is a little less likely to want to patch things up because he is scared of his enemy.
If i is shy, i is a little less likely to want to patch things up.
If i is irritable, i is a little less likely to want to patch things up.
If i is mean, i is a little less likely to want to patch things up.
If i is shallow, i is a little less likely to want to patch things up because shallow people tend to get caught up in/thrive off of petty fights.
If i is domineering, i is a little less likely to want to patch things up.
If i is arrogant, i is less likely to want to patch things up because he will not want to admit to his mistakes.
If i is arrogant, i is less likely to want to patch things up because he will not want to admit to his mistakes.
If i is stubborn, i is less likely to want to patch things up because he will not want to admit to his mistakes.
If i is stubborn, i is less likely to want to patch things up with an enemy.
If i is feeling desperate to be accepted, i might even turn to an enemy for help.
If i did something to r and i is feeling guilty about it, i will be more likely to want to make amends.
If i is feeling lonely, i might try to find friendship in an enemy.
If i has a crush on r, i is more likely to want to make amends so that they can possibly begin a relationship.
If i is popular, i is less likely to want to make amends because i has enough friends already.
If i is angry at r, i is less likely to want to make amends.
If i is annoyed with r, i is less likely to want to make amends.
If r is kind, r will be a little more likely to want to patch things up.
If r is loving, r will be a little more likely to want to patch things up.
If r is sympathetic, r will be a little more likely to want to patch things up.
If r is sympathetic, r will be a little more likely to want to patch things up because r will not want to be caught up in petty matters.
If r is a pacifist, r will be a little more likely to want to patch things up because r will not want to be caught up in a fight.
If r is forgiving, r will be much more likely to want to patch things up because forgiving responder is forgiving.
If r is oblivious, r will be a little more likely to want to patch things up because someone who is oblivious wouldn't know that they were in a fight in the first place.
If r is cold, r will be a little less likely to want to patch things up.
If r is irritable, r will be a little less likely to want to patch things up.
If r is mean, r will be a little less likely to want to patch things up.
If r is shallow, r will be a little less likely to want to patch things up.
If i is a smooth talker, r will be a little less likely to want to patch things up.
If r is arrogant, r will be a little less likely to want to patch things up.
If r is defensive, r will be a little less likely to want to patch things up.
If r is a hothead, r will be a little less likely to want to patch things up.
If r is a vengeful, r will be a little less likely to want to patch things up.
If r is a stubborn, r will be a little less likely to want to patch things up.
If r is a bully, r is less likely to want to make amends.
If r is angry at i, r is less likely to want to make amends.
If r wants to pick on i, r is less likely to want to make amends.
If r was cheated on by i, r is less likely to want to make amends.
If r is popular, r is less likely to want to make amends because r already has enough friends.
If r is cheerful, r is more open to making amends.
If r has a crush on i, r is more likely to want to make amends.
If r pities i, r is more likely to feel bad for i and want to make amends.
If r feels grateful toward i for something good i did recently, r is more likely to want to make amends.

Effect.PerformanceRealization: %i% conceded to %r% and %list(i,r,we/they)% stopped being enemies
%r% shot down %ip% attempt to make amends
%i% %pron(i,was/were)%n't cool enough to convince %r% that %list(i,r,we/they)% should make up
%i% made peace with %r% by letting %pron(r,him/her)% speak %pron(i,his/her)% mind
%list(i,r,and)% stopped being enemies and wondered why anyone fights at all
%r% made fun of %i% for thinking it would be easy to concede to %pron(r,him/her)%
it turned out %CKB_((i,likes),(r,likes),())%s were not enough to bring %list(i,r,and)% back together
%r% %pron(r,was/were)% nice enough to stop being enemies with %i%
%ip% concession turned into a declaration of love for %r%
%r% opened old wounds when %is% tried to make up with %pron(r,him/her)%
%r% %pron(r,was/were)% too vengeful to settle %pron(r,his/her)% differences with %i%
%list(i,r,and)% got over %list(i,r,our/their)% fight and went back to being a happy couple

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: %greeting%, %r%.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: What do you want %i%?

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: I'm just here to... apologize.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: About what?

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: *sigh* ...You are the greatest %gender(r,dude,chick)% in the universe.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Excellent. I will remove you from the 'Most Hated' section of my profile.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: %greeting% %r%.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: You better be here to tell me that I'm right about everything and you're wrong.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Actually yeah, that's pretty much what I was going to say.
So is everything okay then?

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: You thought that by telling me what I already know we could just be friends? What a %pejorative%.

Instantiation.name: Concede - Not being cool enough Reject

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Here comes the lames-mobile. What do you want?

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: I just thought I should tell you that... I don't want to do this anymore. Can't we just make up and get this over with?

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: OMG, are you trying to *make up* with me? That's so totally lame. Get lost before any cool people see me talking to you.
What are you doing here?

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Ummm, I was thinking-

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: That I win, I am right about everything, and you regret ever being enemies with me?

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Yeah, I think?

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Good. You should let me speak your mind more often.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Look, %r%... you win.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Wait what?

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: I was wrong. You were right. Can we stop being enemies now?
Wow. That was so easy...

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Kinda makes you think why anyone ever fights? Considering how easy it is to make up?

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Yeah... it makes you think.
%r%, you win.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Wait what?

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: I was wrong. You were right.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Woah, do you really think it's going to be that easy?

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Um, I was kinda hoping for that, yeah...

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Phst. I knew you were a %pejorative%, but this is really taking it to a whole new level.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Hey, %r%. Listen, I know we've had our differences...
But we also have our similarities!

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Just what are you going on about?

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: We both like %toc1%s!! I can't go on hating someone who likes something so wonderful as %toc1%s...

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Well, that's a nice thought. But there's just one thing left....

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Ugh, Fine. I apologize.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: That's better.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: %r%, let's put this silly bickering behind us.
I know that deep down, you also share a love of %toc1%s with me.
Open your eyes! You and I are like two peas in a pod! We weren't meant to be at each others' throats all the time like this.
Let's bury the hatchet and just move on. What do you say?

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: I don't think I've ever heard that many cliches at once before.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: You're impossible! If %toc1%s can't bring us together, NOTHING CAN!

Instantiation.name: Concede - Trait R: Cat: Nice Accept

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Look. I can't do this anymore. This stress is tearing me apart! You win! Alright!? You win!

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Awww... Come on, %i%... *I'm* sorry. I didn't know it was bothering you so much.
Let's win together, how about that?

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Do you really mean that...?

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Of course!

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Wow... Thanks %r%... I can't imagine how I could have hated someone that's so nice!

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Who knows, who knows...

Instantiation.name: Concede - Status: Has Crush On (i, r) Reject

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Hey there, sexy...

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Excuse me?

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Oh, you know. I've just been... thinking about you in a different light.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: A different light? Sounds like someone has had a few too many cheesytoos.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: %r%, you are so beautiful. Everything about you is amazing.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Okay... You're really starting to creep me out.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Your hair, your eyes, your skin...

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Yeah, I'm gonna go ahead and leave now.

Instantiation.name: Concede - Trait I: Cat: Sharp Accept

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Okay. Okay. I'm sorry.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Cool story.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Jeez, %r%! How many times do I have to tell you for you to put this behind us?!

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Hmmm.... A million.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: FINE! I'm sorry 1,000,000 times!

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: All right, all right. I'll take it.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: It's certainly a beautiful day today, isn't it %r%?

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: I guess so.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: So beautiful, everything is so perfect! I feel like I should spread my cheerfulness!

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: ...You're creeping me out a bit.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Listen %r%! You know what? We should stop being enemies. I concede any outstanding points and apologize for any unresolved conflicts.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: I don't know what's gotten into you, but I'm glad you finally came to your senses.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Sunny skies and brighter pastures, %r%. Brighter pastures.

Instantiation.name: Concede - Status I: Cheerful & SFDB(r, i, mean) Reject

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Hello, %r%! Why, it's a beautiful day. Can't we just be friends?

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Yeah. Right. Like that'll happen.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Come on now, man... let's put it all behind us. I'm willing to let it all go, are you?

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Oh, really? Need I remind you of that time when %toc1%?

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: ...I forgot about that, you %pejorative%.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Well, that was easy.

Instantiation.name: Concede - Trait R: Vengeful & SFDB (i, r, mean) Reject

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Oh great. %i%. You know, I still haven't forgotten about that time when %toc1%!
Everytime I think about it, my blood boils!

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: I know, I know. That's why I came to talk to you about it. I don't want to fight about this any more.
Can't we put it behind us?

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: HAH! Yeah right! And when I'm this close to exacting my revenge?
Tread lightly, %i%. And it wouldn't hurt to keep an eye over your shoulder.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: That's.... weird.
%sweetie%... Why are we doing this?

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Why are we doing this!? Why do you think!

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: I know... I know... We haven't been seeing eye to eye.
But I love you a lot. Enough to say... I'm sorry.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: You don't mean that.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: No! Really! I do. I'm sorry, I concede, you were right and I was wrong. Can't we be a happy couple again?

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Oh %sweetie%. I'm sorry too. I love you.
Not now, %i%.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Not now!? If not now, then *when*!?
Look, %sweetie%. I know you're angry. But I'm sorry! Can't we just resolve this and go back to being a nice happy couple?

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: You call that an apology? This is exactly why we're fighting!
*You* look! Until you grow up, we're staying like this.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Ugh. Whatever.
